description: Ali Moore presents stories on CHOGM; Malcolm Fraser's calls for Sri Lanka to address war crimes; the burial of Gaddafi; the Turkish earthquake; the Tunisian election; and an interview with Alistair Darling, former British Chancellor of the Exchequer.

Tony Jones presents stories on Tony Abbott's opposition to poker machine legislation, including an interview with Andrew Wilkie; the suicide of a Sri Lankan refugee in detention; floods in Bangkok; and an emergency meeting of European leaders.

Tony Jones presents stories on the Eurozone debt deal including an interview with Professor Yanis Varoufakis 
from Athens University; the Malaysian PM arriving for CHOGM; West Papua's independence movement; and the re-opening of the Bolshoi Theatre.

Ali Moore presents stories on the opening of CHOGM; the Qantas AGM; James Packer defending comments that his empire is built on gambling addicts; Bangkok floods; and a round the world yacht race; plus an interview with writer and historian, Paul Ham.
Lateline is a unique nightly news analysis program bringing you up-to-the-minute coverage of Australian and international news and events.
